00048 /*
00049  * Capturando o SIGINT em foreground
00050  */
00051 void catch_SIGINT(int signum)
00052 {
00053     fflush(stdout);
00054     signal(SIGINT, catch_SIGINT);
00055 }
00056 
00057 /*
00058  * Capturando o SIGCONT em foreground
00059  */
00060 void catch_SIGCONT(int signum)
00061 {
00062     fflush(stdout);
00063     signal(SIGCONT,catch_SIGCONT);
00064 }

00066 /*
00067  * Capturando o SIGSTP em foreground
00068  */
00069 void catch_SIGTSTP(int signum)
00070 {
00071         fgstoped = 1;
00072         signal(SIGTSTP,catch_SIGTSTP);
00073 }

00087 void print_help() {
00088         printf("\texit: Exits :(\n\tquit: Same as exit\n\tpwd: Print current working directory\n");
00089         printf("\tcd: Change current directory\n");
00090 }
00094 void print_curr_path() {
00095         char buffer[BUFFER_SIZE] = {};
00096         getcwd(buffer, BUFFER_SIZE);
00097         printf("%s\n", buffer);
00098 }

00106 void mario(char commands[NUM_COMMANDS][TOKENS][BUFFER_SIZE], int num_commands) {
00107         int status;
00108         int pipefds[NUM_COMMANDS][2];
00109         int i, j;
00110         int k;
00111 
00112         pid_t pids[NUM_COMMANDS];
00113 
00114         // Creates every pipe that is going to be needed during execution.
00115         for (i = 0; i < num_commands - 1; i++){
00116                 pipe(pipefds[i]);
00117         }
00118 
00119         // Executes all the commands.
00120         signal(SIGINT, catch_SIGINT);
00121     signal(SIGTSTP, catch_SIGTSTP);
00122         signal(SIGCONT, catch_SIGCONT);
00123         signal(SIGCHLD, catch_SIGCHLD);
00124 
00125         for (i = 0; i < num_commands; i++) {
00126                 pids[i] = fork();
00127 
00128                 // If it's the child.
00129                 if (pids[i] == 0) {
00130                         // Close every unused pipe, leaving only the necessary ones. Important to keep processes from staying alive.
00131                         for (j = 0; j < num_commands - 1; j++) {
00132                                 if (j != i - 1)
00133                                         close(pipefds[j][0]);
00134                                 if (j != i)
00135                                         close(pipefds[j][1]);
00136                         }
00137 
00138                         // Creates a temporary command to be used during the execvp function. Necessary because of the required
00139                         // NULL values in the end of the string vector.
00140                         int l = 0;
00141                         char *v[TOKENS] = {{0}};
00142                         k = 0;
00143                         while (k < TOKENS) {
00144                                 if (strcmp(commands[i][k], " ") && commands[i][k][0] != '\0') {
00145                                         v[l++] = commands[i][k];
00146                                 }
00147                                 k++;
00148                         }
00149                         v[l] = '\0';
00150 
00151                         // If it's the first process to be executed
00152                         if (i == 0) {
00153                                 // Duplicates STDOUT into the pipe and executes the first command
00154                                 dup2(pipefds[i][1], 1);
00155                                 printf("%d\n", execvp(v[0], v));
00156                                 close(pipefds[i][1]);
00157                         // If it's the last command
00158                         } else if (i == num_commands - 1) {
00159                                 // Duplicates STDIN into the pipe and executes
00160                                 dup2(pipefds[i-1][0], 0);
00161                                 printf("%d\n", execvp(v[0], v));
00162                                 close(pipefds[i-1][0]);
00163                         // If it's a command in between
00164                         } else {
00165                                 // Duplicates both STDIN and STDOUT into the pipe and executes
00166                                 dup2(pipefds[i-1][0], 0);
00167                                 dup2(pipefds[i][1], 1);
00168                                 printf("%d\n", execvp(v[0], v));
00169                                 close(pipefds[i-1][0]);
00170                                 close(pipefds[i][1]);
00171                         }
00172                         // Child process exits
00173                         exit(0);
00174                 }
00175         }
00176 
00177         // Close all pipes in the parent process
00178         // No need to check the pid because every child process exits after executing its command
00179         for (j = 0; j < num_commands - 1; j++){
00180                 close(pipefds[j][0]);
00181                 close(pipefds[j][1]);
00182         }
00183 
00184         // Waits for every process to complete execution and then returns
00185         for (i = 0; i < num_commands; i++){
00186                 waitpid(pids[i], &status,  WUNTRACED | WCONTINUED);
00187         }
00188 }

00195 void separate_commands (char splitted[TOKENS][BUFFER_SIZE], int num_of_parameters) {
00196         char comandos[NUM_COMMANDS][TOKENS][BUFFER_SIZE];
00197         int i = 0, j = 0, k = 0;
00198 
00199         while (i < num_of_parameters) {
00200                 // If it's a pipe,
00201                 if (splitted[i][0] == '|') {
00202                         int l;
00203                         // "Erases" the rest of the command.
00204                         for (l = k; l < TOKENS; l++) comandos[j][l][0] = '\0';
00205                         // Resets the number of tokens in a single command.
00206                         k = 0;
00207                         // Increases the number of commands.
00208                         j++;
00209                 }
00210                 else {
00211                         // Copies the token into the current command.
00212                         strncpy(comandos[j][k++], splitted[i], BUFFER_SIZE);
00213                 }
00214                 i++;
00215         }
00216 
00217         // "Erases" the rest of the last command.
00218         while (k < TOKENS) {
00219                 comandos[j][k++][0] = '\0';
00220         }
00221 
00222         // Calls Mario! =)
00223         mario(comandos, j+1);
00224 }

00232 int check_pipe(char splitted[TOKENS][BUFFER_SIZE], int *num_of_parameters) {
00233         int i;
00234         for (i = 1; i < *num_of_parameters; i++) {
00235                 if (!strcmp(splitted[i], "|")) {
00236                         // Calls the function that prepares piped commands to be executed (and then calls the function that executes the pipe =) )
00237                         separate_commands(splitted, *num_of_parameters);
00238                         return 1;
00239                 }
00240         }
00241         return 0;
00242 }

00249 void check_redirect(char splitted[TOKENS][BUFFER_SIZE], int *num_of_parameters) {
00250         int i;
00251         int final_output = 0;
00252         int final_output1 = 0;
00253         int final_input = 0;
00254         char file_temp[BUFFER_SIZE];
00255 
00256         // For every parameter
00257         for (i = 1; i < *num_of_parameters; i++) {
00258                 // If it's an output redirection, obtains the farthest position
00259                 if (!strcmp(splitted[i], ">")) {
00260                         final_output = i;
00261                         strncpy(file_temp, splitted[i+1], BUFFER_SIZE);
00262                         sprintf(splitted[i], " ");
00263                         sprintf(splitted[i+1], " ");
00264                 } else
00265                 // If it's an append redirection, obtains its position
00266                 if (!strcmp(splitted[i], ">>")) {
00267                         final_output1 = i;
00268                         strncpy(file_temp, splitted[i+1], BUFFER_SIZE);
00269                         sprintf(splitted[i], " ");
00270                         sprintf(splitted[i+1], " ");
00271                 } else
00272                 // If it's an input redirection, obtains its position
00273                 if (!strcmp(splitted[i], "<")) {
00274                         final_input = i;
00275                         strncpy(file_temp, splitted[i+1], BUFFER_SIZE);
00276                         sprintf(splitted[i], " ");
00277                         sprintf(splitted[i+1], " ");
00278                 }
00279         }
00280 
00281         // Actually closes STDIN and opens the given file
00282         if (final_input > 0) {
00283                 redir_in = 1;
00284                 fflush(stdin);
00285                 fgetpos(stdin, &pos_in);
00286                 fpin = dup(fileno(stdin));
00287                 freopen(file_temp, "r", stdin);
00288         }
00289 
00290         // No else because both output and input may be redirected in the same line. It is bugged, however
00291         // Closes STDOUT and opens the file. When both > and >> are present, the farthest prevails
00292         if (final_output > 0 || final_output1 > 0) {
00293                 redir_out = 1;
00294                 fflush(stdout);
00295                 fgetpos(stdout, &pos);
00296                 fpout = dup(fileno(stdout));
00297                 if (final_output > final_output1) {
00298                         freopen(file_temp, "w", stdout);
00299                 }       
00300                 if (final_output < final_output1) {
00301                         freopen(file_temp, "a", stdout);
00302                 }
00303         }
00304 }

00310 void redirected() {
00311         // Resets STDOUT
00312         if (redir_out) {
00313                 fflush(stdout);
00314                 dup2(fpout, fileno(stdout));
00315                 close(fpout);
00316                 clearerr(stdout);
00317                 fsetpos(stdout, &pos);
00318         }
00319 
00320         // Resets STDIN
00321         if (redir_in) {
00322                 fflush(stdin);
00323                 dup2(fpin, fileno(stdin));
00324                 close(fpin);
00325                 clearerr(stdin);
00326                 fsetpos(stdin, &pos_in);
00327         }
00328 
00329         redir_out = 0;
00330         redir_in = 0;
00331 }

00341 command_code exec_bin(processes *procs, const char *program, char arguments[TOKENS][BUFFER_SIZE], int num_of_params, int background) {
00342         int no_path = 0;
00343         int i = 0;
00344         char path[BUFFER_SIZE] = {}; 
00345         char filename[BUFFER_SIZE] = {};
00346         DIR *dir = NULL;
00347         command_code comm_ret = COMM_NOP;
00348 
00349         getpath(program, path, BUFFER_SIZE);
00350         getfile(program, filename, BUFFER_SIZE);
00351 
00352         dir = opendir(path);
00353         
00354         // If the folder doesn't exist, returns command not found
00355         // NOTE: If there is no path, we should look in the $PATH with
00356         // execvp
00357         no_path = !strlen(path);
00358         if(!dir && !no_path) {
00359                 comm_ret = COMM_NOTFOUND;
00360         } else {
00361                 pid_t pid;
00362                 int status; 
00363                 
00364                 // If it does, check for the file, or try $PATH
00365                 if(no_path || fileexists(dir, filename)) {
00366                         signal(SIGINT, catch_SIGINT);
00367                 signal(SIGTSTP, catch_SIGTSTP);
00368                         signal(SIGCONT, catch_SIGCONT);
00369                         signal(SIGCHLD, catch_SIGCHLD);
00370                         if(!(pid = fork())) {  //Child process
00371                                 int exec_return;
00372                                 int j = 0;
00373                                 char *v[TOKENS] = {{0}}; // Dont care about the warnings, we are aware of them
00374                                 
00375                                 i = 0;
00376                                 while (i < num_of_params) {
00377                                         // Create a list of pointers to strings of arguments w/o
00378                                         // wasting memory
00379                                         if (strcmp(arguments[i], " ")) {
00380                                                 v[j++] = arguments[i];
00381                                         }
00382                                         i++;
00383                                 }
00384                                 v[j] = '\0';
00385                                 
00386                                 exec_return = execvp(program, v);
00387                                 #ifdef DEBUG
00388                                 if(exec_return < 0) {
00389                                         printf("PAU no: %s\n", strerror(errno));
00390                                         fflush(stdout);
00391                                 }
00392                                 #endif
00393                                 
00394                                 exit(exec_return);                              
00395                         } else {                //Crash
00396                                 // Getting the process information
00397                                 
00398                                 process proc;
00399                                 
00400                                 proc.pid = pid;
00401 
00402                                 strcpy(proc.name, program);
00403                                 strcpy(proc.status, RUN);
00404 
00405                                 insert_process(procs, proc);    // Inserting process in the list
00406                                 
00407 
00408                                 if(!background){
00409                                         waitpid (pid, &status, WUNTRACED | WCONTINUED);
00410 
00411                                         if(fgstoped){
00412                                                 int number = find_process(procs,pid);
00413                                                 if (number>=0)
00414                                                         strcpy(procs->list[number].status,STP);
00415                                         }
00416                                         else {
00417                                                 remove_process(procs,pid);              
00418                                         }
00419                                         fgstoped = 0;
00420 
00421                                 }
00422 
00423                                 redirected();                                   
00424                                 // Verify the exit status from the child process
00425                                 if(WIFEXITED(status)) {
00426 
00427                                         if(WEXITSTATUS(status) == 255) { 
00428                                                 comm_ret = COMM_NOTFOUND;
00429                                         } else {
00430                                                 comm_ret = COMM_EXTERNAL;               
00431                                         }
00432                                 }
00433                         }
00434                 } else {
00435                         comm_ret = COMM_NOTFOUND;
00436                 }
00437         }
00438         if(dir) closedir(dir);
00439         return comm_ret;
00440 }

00449 command_code executioner(processes *procs, const char *command, char parameters[TOKENS][BUFFER_SIZE], int num_of_params, int background) {
00450         command_code comm_code = COMM_NOTFOUND;
00451 
00452         if (strlen(command) < 1) return COMM_EXTERNAL; // Technical adjustments for compatibility with mario (Gambiarra)
00453 
00454         if(!strcmp(command, "exit") || !strcmp(command, "quit")) {
00455                 comm_code = COMM_EXIT;
00456         } else 
00457         if(!strcmp(command, "pwd")) {
00458                 print_curr_path();
00459                 comm_code = COMM_PWD;           
00460         } else
00461         if(!strcmp(command, "help")) {
00462                 print_help();
00463                 comm_code = COMM_HELP;
00464         } else
00465         if(!strcmp(command, "cd")) {
00466                 if(num_of_params > 2) {
00467                         printf("Invalid usage, consult the non-existant manual.\n");
00468                         comm_code = COMM_CD;
00469                 } else if(num_of_params <= 2) {
00470                         if(!strcmp(parameters[1], "~") || num_of_params == 1) {
00471                                 chdir(user_info->pw_dir);
00472                                 print_curr_path();
00473                                 comm_code = COMM_CD;
00474                         } else 
00475                         if(direxists(parameters[1])) {
00476                                 chdir(parameters[1]);
00477                                 print_curr_path();
00478                                 comm_code =  COMM_CD;
00479                         } else {
00480                                 comm_code = COMM_DIRNOTFOUND;
00481                         }
00482                 }
00483         } else 
00484         if (!strcmp(command,"jobs")) {
00485                 jobs(*procs);
00486                 comm_code = COMM_JOBS;          
00487         } else 
00488         if (!strcmp(command, "bg")){            
00489                 int i;
00490                 sscanf(parameters[1],"%d", &i);
00491 
00492                 strcpy(procs->list[i-1].status,RUN);
00493 //              printf("[%d] [%d]\t%s\t%s\n", i , procs->list[i-1].pid, procs->list[i-1].name, procs->list[i-1].status);
00494 
00495                 kill(procs->list[i].pid, SIGCONT);
00496                 // Implement a seeking code in order to verify if the process incidates exists
00497                 comm_code = COMM_BG;
00498         } else 
00499         if(!strcmp(command, "fg")){
00500                 int i,status;
00501                 sscanf(parameters[1],"%d", &i);
00502 
00503                 signal(SIGINT, catch_SIGINT);
00504             signal(SIGTSTP, catch_SIGTSTP);
00505                 signal(SIGCONT, catch_SIGCONT);
00506                 signal(SIGCHLD, catch_SIGCHLD);
00507 
00508                 kill(procs->list[i].pid, SIGCONT);
00509                 strcpy(procs->list[i].status,RUN);
00510                 
00511                 waitpid (procs->list[i].pid, &status, WUNTRACED);
00512 
00513                 comm_code = COMM_FG;            
00514                 // Implement a seeking code in order to verify if the process incidates exists
00515         } else {
00516                 // Try to run a binary, since its not built-in program
00517                 comm_code = exec_bin(procs, command, parameters, num_of_params, background);
00518         }
00519         
00520         switch(comm_code) {
00521                 case COMM_NOTFOUND:
00522                 printf("Command not found, try again, or not.\n");
00523                 break;
00524                 
00525                 case COMM_DIRNOTFOUND:
00526                 printf("Directory not found, try 'ls'.\n");
00527                 break;
00528                         printf("executioner\n");
00529 
00530                 default:
00531                 break;
00532         }
00533         
00534         return comm_code;
00535 }
